author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four youngsters, including two juveniles, were arrested by Madurai City police on Saturday in connection with the murder of a lorry owner on Thursday night, allegedly over a petty scuffle.

The incident occurred when the deceased, T. Ananda Ramesh (52), was returning home with his son A. Selva Kumar (23) on a two-wheeler around 1.30 a.m. The police said that when they were nearing a flour mill in Ramiah Street in Jaihindpuram, they noticed about 10 men walking ahead completely blocking the road. A wordy quarrel broke out when Ananda Ramesh sternly asked the men, mostly youngsters, to give way.

The quarrel soon escalated and the 10 men allegedly attacked Ananda Ramesh and Selva Kumar with boulders and logs. Selva Kumar managed to escape to alert his friends and the police. However, when he returned, he found his father lying dead.

Based on his complaint, a case was registered at Jaihindpuram police station. Investigation revealed that the men were returning from a marriage party in Jeeva Nagar.

The arrested have been identified as Surya alias ‘Dog’ Surya (22), Siva Kumar alias ‘Kutti’ Siva (23) and two juveniles, aged 18 and 17. The police are on the lookout for the others.
title: Four held in murder case
